results.title: Dr. No
results.brief_description: In 1962, audiences were introduced to the suave super spy James Bond in the first instalment of the classic franchise, <.i>Dr. No. Bond, James Bond has since shot up the screen 25 times and become a pop-culture icon.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

results.description: Dr. No is a 1962 spy film directed by Terence Young. It is based on the 1958 novel of the same name by Ian Fleming. Starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Joseph Wiseman, and Jack Lord, it is the first film in the James Bond series, and was adapted by Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, and Berkely Mather.
description_for_label: Dr. No is a 1962 spy film directed by Terence Young. It is based on the 1958 novel of the same name by Ian Fleming. Starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Joseph Wiseman, and Jack Lord, it is the first film in the James Bond series, and was adapted by Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, and Berkely Mather.

results.title: Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog
results.brief_description: Aspiring super-villain Dr. Horrible wants to join the Evil League of Evil and win the girl of his dreams, but his nemesis, Captain Hammer, stops him at every turn.

constellations_other.name: Music and fandom
constellations_other.description: Sometimes fans create their own amazing artworks.

results.description: Aspiring super-villain Dr. Horrible wants to join the Evil League of Evil and win the girl of his dreams, but his nemesis, Captain Hammer, stops him at every turn.
description_for_label: Aspiring super-villain Dr. Horrible wants to join the Evil League of Evil and win the girl of his dreams, but his nemesis, Captain Hammer, stops him at every turn.

results.title: Downton Abbey
results.creator_credit: Liz Trubridge, Julian Fellowes, Michael Engler, Donal Woods, Gareth Neame, Focus Features, Carnival Films & Television and Perfect World Pictures
results.brief_description: The beloved Crawleys and their intrepid staff prepare for the most important moment of their lives. A royal visit from the King and Queen of England will unleash scandal, romance and intrigue that will leave the future of Downton hanging in the balance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Liz Trubridge, Julian Fellowes, Michael Engler, Donal Woods, Gareth Neame, Focus Features, Carnival Films & Television and Perfect World Pictures
results.description: The beloved Crawleys and their intrepid staff prepare for the most important moment of their lives. A royal visit from the King and Queen of England will unleash scandal, romance and intrigue that will leave the future of Downton hanging in the balance.

results.title: Downton Abbey
results.creator_credit: Carnival Films & Television and ITV Studios
results.brief_description: A chronicle of the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants in the post-Edwardian era—with great events in history having an effect on their lives and on the British social hierarchy.
results.description: A chronicle of the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants in the post-Edwardian era—with great events in history having an effect on their lives and on the British social hierarchy.
description_for_label: A chronicle of the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants in the post-Edwardian era—with great events in history having an effect on their lives and on the British social hierarchy.

results.title: Downfall
results.brief_description: Downfall follows Adolf Hitler’s last days in Berlin as Russian and Allied forces close in.

constellations_other.name: Undercutting extremism with absurdity
constellations_other.description: Taika Waititi's satirical performance as Adolf Hitler in Jojo Rabbit connects to a number of other portrayals that includes ill-fated (and conceived) TV shows, memes, high camp and cinema classics.

constellations_other.name: Atari’s Basketball
constellations_other.description: Released in 1979, just in time for the arcade heydays of the early 1980s, Atari’s Basketball was the first basketball game to use a trackball as the input mechanic and a 45-degree angled side view. This set the standard for basketball games that followed.

results.description: In April of 1945, Germany stands at the brink of defeat with the Russian Army closing in from the east and the Allied Expeditionary Force attacking from the west. In Berlin, capital of the Third Reich, Adolf Hitler proclaims that Germany will still achieve victory and orders his generals and advisers to fight to the last man. When the end finally does come, and Hitler lies dead by his own hand, what is left of his military must find a way to end the killing that is the Battle of Berlin, and lay down their arms in surrender.
description_for_label: In April of 1945, Germany stands at the brink of defeat with the Russian Army closing in from the east and the Allied Expeditionary Force attacking from the west. In Berlin, capital of the Third Reich, Adolf Hitler proclaims that Germany will still achieve victory and orders his generals and advisers to fight to the last man. When the end finally does come, and Hitler lies dead by his own hand, what is left of his military must find a way to end the killing that is the Battle of Berlin, and lay down their arms in surrender.

results.title: Don Juan
results.brief_description: Don Juan is a 1926 American romantic adventure film directed by Alan Crosland and starring John Barrymore. It is the first feature-length film to utilise the Vitaphone sound-on-disc sound system with a synchronised musical score and sound effects, though it has no spoken dialogue.

constellations_other.name: Sound and Hollywood
constellations_other.description: The impact of sound on Tinsel Town stretches from the beginning of cinema to recent award-winners, as well as the biggest band in K-Pop.

results.description: Don Juan is a 1926 American romantic adventure film directed by Alan Crosland and starring John Barrymore. It is the first feature-length film to utilise the Vitaphone sound-on-disc sound system with a synchronised musical score and sound effects, though it has no spoken dialogue. The film has the most kisses in film history, with Barrymore kissing (all together) Mary Astor and Estelle Taylor 127 times.
description_for_label: Don Juan is a 1926 American romantic adventure film directed by Alan Crosland and starring John Barrymore. It is the first feature-length film to utilise the Vitaphone sound-on-disc sound system with a synchronised musical score and sound effects, though it has no spoken dialogue. The film has the most kisses in film history, with Barrymore kissing (all together) Mary Astor and Estelle Taylor 127 times.

results.title: Don't Think I've Forgotten: Cambodia's Lost Rock and Roll
results.headline_credit: Cambodia, France and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: Through the eyes, words and songs of its popular music stars of the 50s, 60s, and 70s, Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten: Cambodia’s Lost Rock and Roll examines and unravels Cambodia’s tragic past, culminating in the genocidal Khmer Rouge’s dismantling of the society and murder of 2,000,000 of its citizens.

constellations_other.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_other.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.

results.title_for_label: Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten: Cambodia’s Lost Rock and Roll
results.headline_credit_for_label: Cambodia, France and United States of America, 2014
results.description: Through the eyes, words and songs of its popular music stars of the 50s, 60s, and 70s, Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten: Cambodia’s Lost Rock and Roll examines and unravels Cambodia’s tragic past, culminating in the genocidal Khmer Rouge’s dismantling of the society and murder of 2,000,000 of its citizens.
description_for_label: Through the eyes, words and songs of its popular music stars of the 50s, 60s, and 70s, Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten: Cambodia’s Lost Rock and Roll examines and unravels Cambodia’s tragic past, culminating in the genocidal Khmer Rouge’s dismantling of the society and murder of 2,000,000 of its citizens.

results.title: Dogtown and Z-Boys
results.creator_credit: Agi Orsi Productions, Vans (US), Stacy Peralta and Craig Stecyk
results.brief_description: This award-winning, thrilling story is about a group of discarded kids who revolutionized skateboarding and shaped the attitude and culture of modern day extreme sports. Featuring old skool skating footage, exclusive interviews and a blistering rock soundtrack, DOGTOWN AND Z-BOYS captures the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team from Venice’s Dogtown, a tough “locals only” beach with a legacy of outlaw surfing.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Agi Orsi Productions, Vans (US), Stacy Peralta and Craig Stecyk
results.description: This award-winning, thrilling story is about a group of discarded kids who revolutionized skateboarding and shaped the attitude and culture of modern day extreme sports. Featuring old skool skating footage, exclusive interviews and a blistering rock soundtrack, DOGTOWN AND Z-BOYS captures the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team from Venice’s Dogtown, a tough “locals only” beach with a legacy of outlaw surfing.
description_for_label: This award-winning, thrilling story is about a group of discarded kids who revolutionized skateboarding and shaped the attitude and culture of modern day extreme sports. Featuring old skool skating footage, exclusive interviews and a blistering rock soundtrack, DOGTOWN AND Z-BOYS captures the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team from Venice’s Dogtown, a tough “locals only” beach with a legacy of outlaw surfing.

results.title: Dogs in Space
results.brief_description: Melbourne, Australia 1978. The punk phenomenon is sweeping the country and Dogs In Space, a punk group, are part of it. A ragtag collection of outcasts live in a squat, surviving on a diet of old TV space films, drugs and good music.

constellations_other.name: Aboriginal History Archive
constellations_other.description: The Aboriginal History Archive at Victoria University, led by Gary Foley, is dedicated to the collection and preservation of First Peoples' stories and cultural material. The political activism of the Black Power movement in the 1970s is intersected with representation of Aboriginal actors on screen.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but they’re scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.description:
Set in a share-house occupied by a collection of social misfits, the film focuses on the tumultuous affair between vivacious Anna (Saskia Post) and drug-taking Sam (Michael Hutchence), front man for the band Dogs in Space.

In his first on-screen role, Hutchence pushed against his established public persona.

As the charismatic, sexually charged front man for Australian mainstream rockers INXS, he had legions of fans that were banned from seeing their teen rock idol when the film received an R18+ rating.

With the aid of cinematographer Andrew de Groot’s invaluable camerawork, Lowenstein achieves an intense, fluid evocation of a squalid, destructive lifestyle.

Featuring a sensational post-punk soundtrack courtesy of Iggy Pop, Boys Next Door (aka Birthday Party), Brian Eno and Gang of Four, Dogs in Space has been described by Jennie Kermode in Eye for Film as “less of a film and more of an experience, a poem rather than a conventional story. It’s a remarkable testament to a piece of Australian history most people prefer to ignore.”
description_for_label:
Set in a share-house occupied by a collection of social misfits, the film focuses on the tumultuous affair between vivacious Anna (Saskia Post) and drug-taking Sam (Michael Hutchence), front man for the band Dogs in Space.

In his first on-screen role, Hutchence pushed against his established public persona.

As the charismatic, sexually charged front man for Australian mainstream rockers INXS, he had legions of fans that were banned from seeing their teen rock idol when the film received an R18+ rating.

With the aid of cinematographer Andrew de Groot’s invaluable camerawork, Lowenstein achieves an intense, fluid evocation of a squalid, destructive lifestyle.

Featuring a sensational post-punk soundtrack courtesy of Iggy Pop, Boys Next Door (aka Birthday Party), Brian Eno and Gang of Four, Dogs in Space has been described by Jennie Kermode in Eye for Film as “less of a film and more of an experience, a poem rather than a conventional story. It’s a remarkable testament to a piece of Australian history most people prefer to ignore.”

results.title: Dog Day Afternoon
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of would-be Brooklyn bank robbers John Wojtowicz and Salvatore Naturale. Sonny and Sal attempt a bank heist which quickly turns sour and escalates into a hostage situation and stand-off with the police. As Sonny’s motives for the robbery are slowly revealed and things become more complicated, the heist turns into a media circus.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.
